title: Flare overview
section: Comparison of hard and soft flares
text:
Comparison of hard and soft flares

Codeflare.comb <- rbind(
  data.frame(ParticipantNo = flares$ParticipantNo,
           Cens = flares$hardflare,
           time = flares$hardflare_time,
           type = "hard flare"),
  data.frame(ParticipantNo = flares$ParticipantNo,
             Cens = flares$softflare,
             time = flares$softflare_time,
             type = "soft flare")
  )

flare.comb <- flare.comb %>%
  drop_na(Cens, time)

flare.comb$type <- as.factor(flare.comb$type)


fit <- survfit(Surv(time, Cens) ~ type, data = flare.comb)


p <- ggsurvplot(fit,
                data = flare.comb,
                conf.int = TRUE,
                pval = FALSE,
                pval.method = FALSE,
                ggtheme = theme_minimal(),
                risk.table = TRUE,
                palette = c("#4a938e", "#e493a3"),
                xlab = "Time from study recrutiment (days)",
                legend.title = "Flare type",
                tables.y.text = FALSE,
                tables.col = "strata",
                break.time.by = 300,
                xlim = c(0, 2200)
) 

cairo_pdf("../plots/flare-comparison.pdf", width = 7, height = 7)
p
invisible(dev.off())
saveRDS(p, paste0(outdir, "flare-comparison.RDS"))

p

title: Demographic data
text:
Codelibrary(readxl)
library(tidyverse)
library(datefixR)
library(survival)
library(survminer)
library(pander)
library(coxme)
library(finalfit)
library(DescTools)
library(gtsummary)


# paths to PREdiCCt data
if (file.exists("/docker")) { # If running in docker
  data.path <- "/analysis/data/final/20221004/"
  redcap.path <- "/analysis/data/final/20231030/"
  prefix <- "/analysis/data/end-of-follow-up/"
  outdir <- "/analysis/data/processed/"
} else { # Run on OS directly
  data.path <- "/Volumes/igmm/cvallejo-predicct/predicct/final/20221004/"
  redcap.path <- "/Volumes/igmm/cvallejo-predicct/predicct/final/20231030/"
  prefix <- "/Volumes/igmm/cvallejo-predicct/predicct/end-of-follow-up/"
  outdir <- "/Volumes/igmm/cvallejo-predicct/predicct/processed/"
}

demo <- readRDS(paste0(outdir, "demo-full.RDS"))
demo$FC <- log(demo$FC)

cox.summary <- function(fit, data = NULL) {
  cat("Cox model summary:")
  fit %>%
    finalfit::fit2df(condense = FALSE) %>%
    knitr::kable(
      col.names = c(
        "Variable",
        "HR",
        "Lower 95%",
        "Upper 95%",
        "P-value"
      ),
      digits = 4
    ) %>%
    print()
  
    if (!is.null (data)) {
    selector <- colnames(fit$x) %in% colnames(data) # Find continuous vars
    sd.vec <- apply(as.matrix(fit$x[, selector]), 2, sd)
    
    adj.table <- fit %>%
      finalfit::fit2df(condense = FALSE)
    adj.table <- adj.table[selector, ]
    adj.table[, 2:4] <-  adj.table[, 2:4] ^ sd.vec
    
    cat("\\newline

HR per SD: \\newline

")
    
    adj.table  %>%
      knitr::kable(
        col.names = c(
          "Variable",
          "HR",
          "Lower 95%",
          "Upper 95%",
          "P-value"),
      digits = 4,
      row.names = FALSE) %>%
      print()
  }

  cat("\\newline

Diagnostics: \\newline

")

  cat("\\newline

::: {.panel-tabset}

      ")

  cat("

###### Proportional hazards assumption test \\newline

  ")
  cox.zph(fit)$table %>%
    knitr::kable(
      col.names = c(
        "",
        "Chi-squared statistic",
        "DF",
        "P-value"
      ),
      digits = 4
    ) %>%
    print()

  cat("\\newline

###### DF betas \\newline

  ")

  print(ggcoxdiagnostics(fit, type = "dfbeta"))

  cat("\\newline

###### Martingale residuals \\newline

      ")

  print(ggcoxdiagnostics(fit, type = "martingale", linear.predictions = TRUE))

  cat("\\newline

:::

      ")
  return()
}

flare.df <- readRDS(paste0(outdir, "flares-contolled.RDS"))
flare.cd.df <- readRDS(paste0(outdir, "flares-controlled-cd.RDS"))
flare.uc.df <- readRDS(paste0(outdir, "flares-controlled-uc.RDS"))

The page describing demographic variables in a descriptive manner can be found here.

library(tidyverse)
library(datefixR)
library(survival)
library(survminer)
library(pander)
library(coxme)
library(finalfit)
library(DescTools)
library(gtsummary)


# paths to PREdiCCt data
if (file.exists("/docker")) { # If running in docker
  data.path <- "/analysis/data/final/20221004/"
  redcap.path <- "/analysis/data/final/20231030/"
  prefix <- "/analysis/data/end-of-follow-up/"
  outdir <- "/analysis/data/processed/"
} else { # Run on OS directly
  data.path <- "/Volumes/igmm/cvallejo-predicct/predicct/final/20221004/"
  redcap.path <- "/Volumes/igmm/cvallejo-predicct/predicct/final/20231030/"
  prefix <- "/Volumes/igmm/cvallejo-predicct/predicct/end-of-follow-up/"
  outdir <- "/Volumes/igmm/cvallejo-predicct/predicct/processed/"
}

demo <- readRDS(paste0(outdir, "demo-full.RDS"))
demo$FC <- log(demo$FC)

cox.summary <- function(fit, data = NULL) {
  cat("Cox model summary:")
  fit %>%
    finalfit::fit2df(condense = FALSE) %>%
    knitr::kable(
      col.names = c(
        "Variable",
        "HR",
        "Lower 95%",
        "Upper 95%",
        "P-value"
      ),
      digits = 4
    ) %>%
    print()
  
    if (!is.null (data)) {
    selector <- colnames(fit$x) %in% colnames(data) # Find continuous vars
    sd.vec <- apply(as.matrix(fit$x[, selector]), 2, sd)
    
    adj.table <- fit %>%
      finalfit::fit2df(condense = FALSE)
    adj.table <- adj.table[selector, ]
    adj.table[, 2:4] <-  adj.table[, 2:4] ^ sd.vec
    
    cat("\\newline

HR per SD: \\newline

")
    
    adj.table  %>%
      knitr::kable(
        col.names = c(
          "Variable",
          "HR",
          "Lower 95%",
          "Upper 95%",
          "P-value"),
      digits = 4,
      row.names = FALSE) %>%
      print()
  }

  cat("\\newline

Diagnostics: \\newline

")

  cat("\\newline

::: {.panel-tabset}

      ")

  cat("

###### Proportional hazards assumption test \\newline

  ")
  cox.zph(fit)$table %>%
    knitr::kable(
      col.names = c(
        "",
        "Chi-squared statistic",
        "DF",
        "P-value"
      ),
      digits = 4
    ) %>%
    print()

  cat("\\newline

###### DF betas \\newline

  ")

  print(ggcoxdiagnostics(fit, type = "dfbeta"))

  cat("\\newline

###### Martingale residuals \\newline

      ")

  print(ggcoxdiagnostics(fit, type = "martingale", linear.predictions = TRUE))

  cat("\\newline

:::

      ")
  return()
}

flare.df <- readRDS(paste0(outdir, "flares-contolled.RDS"))
flare.cd.df <- readRDS(paste0(outdir, "flares-controlled-cd.RDS"))
flare.uc.df <- readRDS(paste0(outdir, "flares-controlled-uc.RDS"))


This page describes associations between demographic data and time-to-flare.
The page describing demographic variables in a descriptive manner can be found here.

title: Demographic data
text:
Age
Crohn’s disease


Soft flare
Hard flare



Codeflare.cd.df$Agecat <- cut(flare.cd.df$Age,
  c(0, 18, 30, 45, 65, Inf),
  labels = c("< 18", "18-29", "30-44", "45-64", ">=65"),
  right = FALSE
)


fit <- survfit(Surv(softflare_time, softflare) ~ Agecat,
  data = flare.cd.df
)

p <- ggsurvplot(fit,
  data = flare.cd.df,
  conf.int = TRUE,
  pval = TRUE,
  pval.method = TRUE,
  ggtheme = theme_minimal(),
  risk.table = TRUE,
  legend.title = "Age",
  palette = c("#1A8FE3", "#E76D83", "#5FB49C", "#FED766", "green"),
  xlab = "Time from study recrutiment (days)",
  title = "Time to soft flare",
  break.time.by = 200
)

cairo_pdf("../plots/cd/soft-flare/demographics/age.pdf")
p
invisible(dev.off())

png("../plots/cd/soft-flare/demographics/age.png",
  width = 7,
  height = 7,
  units = "in",
  res = 300
)
p
invisible(dev.off())

p

Codefit.me <- coxph(
  Surv(softflare_time, softflare) ~
    Sex + IMD + cat + Age + frailty(SiteNo),
  control = coxph.control(outer.max = 20),
  data = flare.cd.df,
  x = TRUE
)

title: Biochemistry
text:
Codelibrary(readxl)
library(tidyverse)
library(datefixR)
library(survival)
library(survminer)
library(pander)
library(coxme)
library(finalfit)
library(DescTools)
library(gtsummary)


# paths to PREdiCCt data
if (file.exists("/docker")) { # If running in docker
  data.path <- "/analysis/data/final/20221004/"
  redcap.path <- "/analysis/data/final/20231030/"
  prefix <- "/analysis/data/end-of-follow-up/"
  outdir <- "/analysis/data/processed/"
} else { # Run on OS directly
  data.path <- "/Volumes/igmm/cvallejo-predicct/predicct/final/20221004/"
  redcap.path <- "/Volumes/igmm/cvallejo-predicct/predicct/final/20231030/"
  prefix <- "/Volumes/igmm/cvallejo-predicct/predicct/end-of-follow-up/"
  outdir <- "/Volumes/igmm/cvallejo-predicct/predicct/processed/"
}

demo <- readRDS(paste0(outdir, "demo-full.RDS"))
demo$FC <- log(demo$FC)

cox.summary <- function(fit, data = NULL) {
  cat("Cox model summary:")
  fit %>%
    finalfit::fit2df(condense = FALSE) %>%
    knitr::kable(
      col.names = c(
        "Variable",
        "HR",
        "Lower 95%",
        "Upper 95%",
        "P-value"
      ),
      digits = 4
    ) %>%
    print()
  
  if (!is.null (data)) {
    selector <- colnames(fit$x) %in% colnames(data) # Find continuous vars
    sd.vec <- apply(as.matrix(fit$x[, selector]), 2, sd)
    
    adj.table <- fit %>%
      finalfit::fit2df(condense = FALSE)
    adj.table <- adj.table[selector, ]
    adj.table[, 2:4] <-  adj.table[, 2:4] ^ sd.vec
    
    cat("\\newline

HR per SD: \\newline

")
    
    adj.table  %>%
      knitr::kable(
        col.names = c(
          "Variable",
          "HR",
          "Lower 95%",
          "Upper 95%",
          "P-value"),
      digits = 4,
      row.names = FALSE) %>%
      print()
  }
  
  cat("\\newline
  
Diagnostics: \\newline
  
")
  
  cat('\\newline
  
::: {.panel-tabset} 

      ')
  
  cat("
  
###### Proportional hazards assumption test \\newline

  ")
  cox.zph(fit)$table %>%
    knitr::kable(
      col.names = c(
        "",
        "Chi-squared statistic",
        "DF",
        "P-value"
      ),
      digits = 4
    ) %>%
    print()
  
  cat("\\newline

###### DF betas \\newline

  ")
  
  print(ggcoxdiagnostics(fit, type = "dfbeta"))
  
  cat("\\newline 
  
###### Martingale residuals \\newline
      
      ")
  
  print(ggcoxdiagnostics(fit, type = "martingale", linear.predictions = TRUE))
  
  cat("\\newline
  
:::

      ")
  return()
}

flare.uc.df <- readRDS(paste0(outdir, "flares-IBD-uc.RDS"))

text:
Codelibrary(readxl)
library(tidyverse)
library(datefixR)
library(survival)
library(survminer)
library(pander)
library(coxme)
library(finalfit)
library(DescTools)
library(gtsummary)


# paths to PREdiCCt data
if (file.exists("/docker")) { # If running in docker
  data.path <- "/analysis/data/final/20221004/"
  redcap.path <- "/analysis/data/final/20231030/"
  prefix <- "/analysis/data/end-of-follow-up/"
  outdir <- "/analysis/data/processed/"
} else { # Run on OS directly
  data.path <- "/Volumes/igmm/cvallejo-predicct/predicct/final/20221004/"
  redcap.path <- "/Volumes/igmm/cvallejo-predicct/predicct/final/20231030/"
  prefix <- "/Volumes/igmm/cvallejo-predicct/predicct/end-of-follow-up/"
  outdir <- "/Volumes/igmm/cvallejo-predicct/predicct/processed/"
}

demo <- readRDS(paste0(outdir, "demo-full.RDS"))
demo$FC <- log(demo$FC)

cox.summary <- function(fit, data = NULL) {
  cat("Cox model summary:")
  fit %>%
    finalfit::fit2df(condense = FALSE) %>%
    knitr::kable(
      col.names = c(
        "Variable",
        "HR",
        "Lower 95%",
        "Upper 95%",
        "P-value"
      ),
      digits = 4
    ) %>%
    print()
  
  if (!is.null (data)) {
    selector <- colnames(fit$x) %in% colnames(data) # Find continuous vars
    sd.vec <- apply(as.matrix(fit$x[, selector]), 2, sd)
    
    adj.table <- fit %>%
      finalfit::fit2df(condense = FALSE)
    adj.table <- adj.table[selector, ]
    adj.table[, 2:4] <-  adj.table[, 2:4] ^ sd.vec
    
    cat("\\newline

HR per SD: \\newline

")
    
    adj.table  %>%
      knitr::kable(
        col.names = c(
          "Variable",
          "HR",
          "Lower 95%",
          "Upper 95%",
          "P-value"),
      digits = 4,
      row.names = FALSE) %>%
      print()
  }
  
  cat("\\newline
  
Diagnostics: \\newline
  
")
  
  cat('\\newline
  
::: {.panel-tabset} 

      ')
  
  cat("
  
###### Proportional hazards assumption test \\newline

  ")
  cox.zph(fit)$table %>%
    knitr::kable(
      col.names = c(
        "",
        "Chi-squared statistic",
        "DF",
        "P-value"
      ),
      digits = 4
    ) %>%
    print()
  
  cat("\\newline

###### DF betas \\newline

  ")
  
  print(ggcoxdiagnostics(fit, type = "dfbeta"))
  
  cat("\\newline 
  
###### Martingale residuals \\newline
      
      ")
  
  print(ggcoxdiagnostics(fit, type = "martingale", linear.predictions = TRUE))
  
  cat("\\newline
  
:::

      ")
  return()
}

Codeflare.cd.df$CReactiveProtein_cat <- cut(flare.cd.df$CReactiveProtein, 
                                        c(0, 5, 10.0000001, Inf),
                                        labels = c("CRP < 5",
                                                   "5 ≤ CRP ≤ 10",
                                                   "CRP > 10"),
                                        include.lowest = TRUE,
                                        right = FALSE)

               data = flare.cd.df
)

p <- ggsurvplot(fit,
  data = flare.cd.df,
  conf.int = TRUE,
  pval = TRUE,
  pval.method = TRUE,
  ggtheme = theme_minimal(),

  legend.title = "CRP",

text:
Platelets
